original_title: Sri Lanka’s tax revenues for 2023 revised up to Rs2,752bn: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s tax revenues for 2023 have been revised up to 2,752 billion rupees, with economic activity picking up and results of broadening the tax base and reforms bringing results, State Minister for Finance Shehan Semasinghe said.
A budget for 2024 presented in November, estimated tax revenues at 2,596 billion rupees, and total revenues and grants at 2,851 billion rupees.
Total revenues and grants have been revised up to over 3,100 billion rupees with non-tax revenues and grants estimated at 363 billion rupees, Minister Semasinghe said.
Sri Lanka revenues may improve to 11.2 percent of GDP in 2023, he said. T
he November budget projected total revenues of 10.1 percent, up from 8.2 percent in 2022.

A primary surplus in the budget is now expected 2023, compared to a deficit agreed with the International Monetary Fund. The primary balance is the main performance criteria for the budget in the IMF program.
The primary balance target in the IMF program was a deficit of 209 billion rupees. (Colombo/Jan1/2023)
